Issues.Title: Unable to identify scroll bar "Page down" or other internal scroll bar object using UIAutomation
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`): 3.0.1.302
* Windows version: (`winver`): Windows 10/Windows Server 2012/ Windows Server 2016
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 
We are automating windows Desktop applications using UIAutomation library. We were using net472 previously and now switched to .net core 3.1.

csproj file entries:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> 
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop"> 
  <PropertyGroup> 
    <OutputType>Library</OutputType> 
    <TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp3.1</TargetFrameworks> 
    <UseWPF>true</UseWPF> 
    <UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms>
We are using the following code to identify the objects at runtime using UIAutomation library.

using System.Windows.Automation;
PropertyCondition condition=new PropertyCondition(AutomationElement.NameProperty, “nameOfObject”)
AutomationElementCollection collection=windowElement.FindAll(TreeScope.Descendants, condition); 
Most of the objects are working but the objects inside the scroll bar are not identifiable using code.
[WindowsFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5303322/WindowsFormsApp1.zip)
[NetCoreSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5303324/NetCoreSample.zip)
[netframeworkCode.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5303325/netframeworkCode.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to identify scroll bar "Page down" or other internal scroll bar object using UIAutomation" (#3597)

Issues.Title: Fix the casing of 'Shared' in WpfSharedDir
Issues.Body:
The value was specified with a lower case 's', but the directory in Git is spelt with a capital 'S'. This discrepancy causes failures on source server lookups. For example, stepping into `MS.Utility.FrugalList` tries to load (using .NET 5.0 RC1):

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/wpf/be89bbfaded6ad3f0f4143bf1a8dd075a5789715/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/shared/MS/Utility/FrugalList.cs

but the server returns a 404 response. The source is actually at:

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/wpf/be89bbfaded6ad3f0f4143bf1a8dd075a5789715/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Shared/MS/Utility/FrugalList.cs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix the casing of 'Shared' in WpfSharedDir" (#3594)

Issues.Title: Add RowSpacing and ColumnSpacing to Grid (similar to Uwp)
Issues.Body:
The Grid in UWP has a property called [ColumnSpacing](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.ui.xaml.controls.grid.columnspacing?view=winrt-19041#Windows_UI_Xaml_Controls_Grid_ColumnSpacing) and a similar RowSpacing property that:

> Gets or sets the uniform distance (in pixels) between grid columns.

It would be extremely useful to have this in the wpf version of Grid as well. Adding such a feature would require a minimal change to both the measure and arrange phase of the panel.

The added benefit would be huge, because on a daily basis I have to cludge around with margins on child items to make sure spacing remains correct. Having a uniform spacing would allow me to focus only on those elements in my panels that require custom spacing. It would also make it much more easy to space items dynamically if they were bindable dependency properties.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add RowSpacing and ColumnSpacing to Grid (similar to Uwp)" (#3592)

Issues.Title: Add Spacing property to StackPanel (similar to Uwp)
Issues.Body:
The StackPanel in UWP has a property called [Spacing](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.ui.xaml.controls.stackpanel.spacing?view=winrt-19041) that:

> Gets or sets a uniform distance (in pixels) between stacked items. It is applied in the direction of the StackPanel's Orientation.

It would be extremely useful to have this in the wpf version of StackPanel as well. Adding such a feature would require a minimal change to both the measure and arrange phase of the panel.

The added benefit would be huge, on a daily basis I have to cludge around with margins on child items to make sure spacing remains correct. Having a uniform spacing would allow me to focus only on those elements in my panels that require custom spacing. It would also make it much more easy to space items dynamically if it were a bindable dependency property.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add Spacing property to StackPanel (similar to Uwp)" (#3591)

Issues.Title: Change taskbar icon at runtime on deployed app
Issues.Body:
I would like to change taskbar icon to identity what type the current app is, so I set a default icon for the app and the icon will be changed according to the type returned from server when the app is launching. 

I just change the icon  like this:

```csharp
Application.Current.MainWindow.Icon = new BitmapImage(new Uri(string.Format("AppLogos/{0}.ico", terminal.TerminalType.Name), UriKind.Relative));
```

It's working well on Visual Studio but I found out that it's not changing my task bar on deployed app (Install the app using a MSI file).

So is there a way to do it?

**UPDATE**

To force the icon refresh on my deployed app I have to pin/unpin my icon taskbar, unfortunately this is a user command only so I can't do this in wpf programmatically.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change taskbar icon at runtime on deployed app" (#3590)

Issues.Title: App resource threading issue
Issues.Body:
Addresses #3563 
This is a port of a servicing fix in .NET 4.7-4.8

**Issue:** Crash when multi-threaded app loads app resources

**Discussion:**
There is a race condition when two threads try to add parts to one of the app's predefined packages (ResourceContainer or SiteOfOriginContainer), one from Application.GetResourceOrContentPart or Application.GetResourceStream, and the other from PackWebResponse+CachedResponse.GetResponseStream.  These two codepaths use different lock objects to synchronize access to the package, so they can interleave.  An unfavorable interleaving during the time they are actually adding to the package's underlying SortedList can corrupt the list (it's not thread-safe), leaving it with entries in the wrong order and/or spurious 'null' entries.  This breaks the binary search lookup algorithm, and leads to the FailFast crashes.

Fixed by using the same lock object on all codepaths that call GetPart.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "App resource threading issue" (#3577)

Issues.Title: DataGrid.Copy: fail silently if clipboard is locked
Issues.Body:
Addresses #3113 
This is a port of a servicing fix in .NET 4.5-4.8

**Issue:**  DataGrid's Copy command crashes the app if the clipboard is locked. 

**Discussion:**
DataGrid's Copy command throws an exception if the clipboard is locked (after the usual round of retries).  There is usually no app code on the stack, so this exception crashes the app.  Other controls that implement Copy (TextBox et al.) simply fail silently - no exception, but nothing gets put on the clipboard.  This is also the way other apps behave (Notepad, Word, browsers, etc.).  This change gives DataGrid that same behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "DataGrid.Copy: fail silently if clipboard is locked" (#3576)

Issues.Title: FixedPage SOM bugs
Issues.Body:
Addresses #3115 
This is a port of a servicing fix in .NET 4.7-4.8.

**Issue:** For certain XPS documents, DocumentViewer cannot select text correctly.

**Discussion:**
There are actually two bugs, both affecting the construction of the FixedPage's "Semantic Object Model".

1.	Each text run is tested to see if it can be combined into the current text block.  The test is intended to recognize when the text and the block are separated by a line drawn somewhere on the page.  The bug arises when the text and the block overlap in both the x- and y-directions, and there is a vertical line that touches the overlap.  The test erroneously thinks the line separates the text from the block, and doesn't combine them.

2.	The lines come from a recursive tree walk of the XPS elements.  The tree walk combines transforms of parent and child elements in the wrong order, leading to the wrong overall transform if the individual transforms don't commute.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "FixedPage SOM bugs" (#3575)

Issues.Title: Move StackTrace to error branch
Issues.Body:
Addresses #3114 
This is a port of a servicing fix in .NET 4.8

**Issue:**  Expensive diagnostic code is running on the normal code-path.

**Discussion:**
A recent servicing fix added code to capture a stack trace whenever a certain anomalous condition occurs.  However it always creates the stack trace, and merely discards it in the normal case.

Fixed by moving the creation of the stack trace into the anomalous branch.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Move StackTrace to error branch" (#3574)

Issues.Title: Application window is resizing unexpectedly while moving to another screen (dpiAwareness PerMonitorV2)
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.301 #7feb845744
* Windows version: 10.0.17134
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 **Problem description:**
Application window is resizing unexpectedly while moving to another screen. It happens only when **dpiAwareness** is set to PerMonitorV2 in the application manifest and the specific screen arrangement is being used:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/922275/94126657-2cc66c80-fe58-11ea-935e-9c6393582dfb.png)

Screen 1: 3840x2160, scaling @ 175%
Screen 2: 1920x1080, scaling @ 100%

 
 **Actual behavior:**

![ice_video_20200924-114639](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/922275/94130182-99436a80-fe5c-11ea-9555-a6ffc58c2565.gif)

 **Expected behavior:**
Resize should be triggered only once when the app is moved between the screens.
 
 **Minimal repro:**
[DpiChangeTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5275241/DpiChangeTest.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Application window is resizing unexpectedly while moving to another screen (dpiAwareness PerMonitorV2)" (#3573)

Issues.Title: ClearType anti-aliasing
Issues.Body:
Addresses #2025 
This is a port of a servicing fix in .NET 4.7-4.8

**Issue:** Text rendered with TextRenderingMode.ClearType send the wrong parameter to DWrite, resulting in poor rendering.

**Discussion:**
The meat of the fix already appears in .NET 5, see #2668.  This PR removes a useless assert, bringing the code into alignment with .NET 4.7/4.8.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ClearType anti-aliasing" (#3570)
